page.title: 15The Glass Factory.
page.content: Helen Brush writes : "On the 2lst May, l985 we went to see Avondale Glass Factory. Wendy Speranza said glass is made of sand and was probably invented in a hot country when the sand melted. She and her husband who run the factory are open during the summer months. We saw her husband make a glass swan. He is Italian and glass making was a family tradition. They looked for sites all over Britain and finally chose Kilgetty partly because of a government grant. They live next door and the son is learning the craft. Coach loads of visitors come to see the place and some buy the ornaments made. Children can have a go at glass blowing."
